medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced sudden onset of continuous, progressive RUQ pain at 4 AM after feeling well following a meal the previous evening. This was associated with nausea and one episode of vomiting. There were no associated fevers, chills, dysuria, change in bowel habits, constipation, or diarrhea. The patient had a prior self-limiting episode of RUQ pain after eating.
